thread.title: Valentine's Day gadget-gifting guide for every budget
thread.title_full: Valentine's Day gadget-gifting guide for every budget

title: Valentine's Day gadget-gifting guide for every budget
text:
Valentine’s Day gadget-gifting guide for every budget Valentine’s Day gadget-gifting guide for every budget By February 10, 2017 “A look at some techy gifts for Valentine’s day” Chocolates? Roses? Dinner reservations? Yawn. These are some of the most common Valentine’s Day gifts people buy for their significant others. Since, your partner is probably tired of these Valentine’s Day cliches, its time to get a little creative and think outside the box. Below is a list of some techy gifts which will give you inspiration on what to buy. We have also taken the liberty of sorting the gifts based on various price segments to help you out even more, so without any further ado, let the shopping commence. Below Rs 1,000 
If you are a little tight on budget this V-Day, fret not. There are plenty of tech accessories that will fit your bill while being romantic at the same time. We’d recommend you to head over to dailyobjects.com and design a customised case for your partner. You can choose a custom image, text or both which will go on the case making it as personal and romantic as you’d like. The website currently has a sale for a limited period where you can buy two cases and avail a maximum discount of Rs 2,000. Below Rs 3,000 
Listening to romantic songs whilst stargazing with your partner never gets old. The Sony MDR-XB70AP or the SoundMagic E50S offer crisp vocals along with decent base to let you enjoy your favourite tracks even more. Both the headphones retail for Rs 2,999 each. Alternatively, you could also go the healthy route and gift your specific other a fitness band. The Xiaomi Mi Band 2 is a great option as it retails for just Rs 2,000 and comes with all the bells and whistles you could think of. Below Rs 5,000 
You are vacationing in a cabin, the firewood is crackling and the champagne is being chilled. All you need to make the evening more romantic is some music. Out comes your gift for your significant other – a Bluetooth speaker, and your evening gets instantly better. We’d recommend you to buy the JBL Flip 2 speaker as it comes with a good battery life, has decent sound and priced at Rs 4,299 sits well within the Rs 5K mark. Below Rs 10,000 
If you’d like to end Valentine’s Day with a big bang (pun intended), why not try to spruce up your activities in the bedroom with the Lovely sex toy? The toy comes with its own app, which doesn’t just measure the calories burnt in the bedroom but also gives you personalised tips as well as new positions to explore. The toy itself acts as a stimulant by vibrating during intercourse. The cost for the same starts at Rs 9,000. Budget no bar 
If you recently came across a lot of fortune from a rich Nigerian prince and want to splurge some of that on your partner, then you should definitely check out the ASUS ZenWatch 3. The unisex smart watch will definitely dazzle you with its traditional Italian craftsmanship and also comes with an AMOLED display, which makes the colours and the texts pop. There is a built-in microphone and a 340mAh battery which supports quick charge with the watch retailing for Rs 18,999 on major e-commerce websites. Facebook Comments
